channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Oil Slides Further as Trump Declares Ceasefire: Markets Wrap
item.description: Oil sank and US stock-index futures climbed after President Donald Trump announced a tentative ceasefire between Israel and Iran, raising hopes that the worst of the Middle East conflict has passed.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

item.title: Oil Extends Collapse as Trump Announces Ceasefire in the Mideast
item.description: Oil extended a slump as US President Donald Trump announced a tentative ceasefire between Iran and Israel.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: Oil storage tanks at the Sunoco LP Terminal in Crockett, California, US, on Friday, Jan. 3, 2025. Oil began 2025 by rising to the highest level since November, boosted by a report of shrinking crude stockpiles in the US and bullish technical indicators.

item.title: Meat Giant JBS Plans First Bond Sale After US Listing to Extend Debt Maturities
item.description: JBS NV sold $3.5 billion in bonds its biggest-ever offering as the world’s largest meat producer took advantage of strong investor appetite to extend maturities on its debt.
item.dc:creator: Gerson Freitas Jr

media:content.media:description: Cattle trucks offload livestock at the JBS Greeley meatpacking facility in Greeley, Colorado, US, on Friday, Feb. 28, 2025. Plans for the biggest deportations in US history threaten to upend the meatpacking industry.

item.title: Private Equity Firms Pursue Asian Loans to Fund Investor Payouts
item.description: Private equity funds are ramping up loan deals in Asia to fund dividend payouts as they struggle to exit corporate buyouts.
item.dc:creator: Kari Soo Lindberg, Chien Mi Wong

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians look out across Victoria Harbour towards the Hong Kong Island skyline in the Tsim Sha Tsui district of Hong Kong, China, on Sunday, June 23, 2024. Four years after Hong Kong began a sweeping crackdown against political dissent, the city is struggling to meet one of its own benchmarks in reassuring foreign investors that it remains a predictable place to do business.

item.title: Equities Finish at Session High | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mexico Joins Debt Sale Rush With $4.5 Billion Bond Deal
item.description: Mexico tapped the global bond market for the third time this year, adding to a rush in debt markets from government and corporate borrowers on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Butler, Vinicius Andrade

media:content.media:description: The Angel of Independence monument in Mexico City.

item.title: Tesla Shares Jump Most in Two Months on Robotaxi Rollout
item.description: Tesla Inc. shares climbed after the automaker rolled out its long-promised driverless taxi service to a handful of riders, a modest debut for what Elon Musk sees as a transformative new business line.
item.dc:creator: Kara Carlson

media:content.media:description: A Tesla robotaxi vehicle in Austin on June 22.

item.title: Iran Disruption Will Be Short Lived: Citi's Layton
item.description: Energy markets are watching the conflict within Iran, as Iran has made threats to close the waterway that could lead to an increase on oil prices. Citi Global Head of Commodities Research Max Layton believes Iranian disruption will be short lived. He speaks with Scarlet Fu on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chewy Backer BC Partners Seeks to Raise $1 Billion in Block Trade
item.description: Funds advised by BC Partners are seeking to sell $1 billion worth of Chewy Inc. shares in a block trade.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Chewy shipping boxes in a Fedex delivery vehicle in New York, US, on Friday, March 1, 2024. Chewy Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on March 20. Photographer: Angus Mordant/Bloomberg

item.title: Bain’s Virgin Australia Set to Start Trading After Relisting
item.description: Bain Capital’s Virgin Australia will begin trading in Sydney on Tuesday after raising A$685 million ($445 million) in one of the country’s biggest initial public offerings this year.
item.dc:creator: Carmeli Argana

media:content.media:description: A Virgin Australia plane takes off at Sydney Airport.

item.title: Latin America Leads EM Currency Bounce Amid Easing Mideast Worry
item.description: Developing-nation currencies were split, with Latin America leading a rebound in US hours as investors wagered that a conflict in the Middle East would remain limited in scope and parsed through signals on the direction of US monetary policy.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Simauchi

item.title: S&P 500 Up 1% as ‘Scripted’ Iran Attacks Sink Oil: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street traders drove stocks higher as oil tumbled, with Iran’s retaliatory strikes at a US air base in Qatar seen as symbolic and unable to trigger a broader economic fallout. The dollar fell.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Oil storage containers in Midland, Texas, US, on Thursday, Oct. 3, 2024. Oil steadied following its biggest one-day jump in almost a year as fears that Israel may decide to strike Iranian crude facilities in retaliation for a missile barrage kept the market on edge.

item.title: Iran Has Lost the War, Ed Yardeni Says
item.description: Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at Yardeni Research, reacts to Iran's retaliatory strikes on a US air base in Qatar, saying Iran has lost the war and it could be transformational for the Middle East. He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Cement Firm Amrize Falls in Spinoff Debut as Holcim Jumps
item.description: Amrize Ltd.’s shares fell in Switzerland following the North American cement-maker’s split from Holcim Ltd., sinking even as its former owner’s stock price climbed.
item.dc:creator: Allegra Catelli

media:content.media:description: A Holcim AG logo during the groundbreaking ceremony of the Holcim GO4ZERO net-zero cement plant in Obourg, Belgium, on Thursday, May 16, 2024. Holcim is going ahead with the net-zero cement plant set to produce 2 million tons of product per year by 2029. Photographer: Simon Wohlfahrt/Bloomberg

item.title: NYC Heat Triggers Blackout as Soaring Temperatures Stress US Grids
item.description: Blistering heat is straining power grids across the eastern half of the US, leading to a blackout in part of New York City’s borough of Queens as the local utility issued a warning to conserve electricity.
item.dc:creator: Tope Alake, Naureen S Malik

media:content.media:description: Residential apartment buildings in front of the Manhattan skyline in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Tuesday, July 16, 2024. President Joe Biden is calling on Congress to pass a form of national rent control for some 20 million apartment units nationwide, a dramatic federal intervention in the housing market on behalf of current tenants.

item.title: US Warns of Iranian Cyber Threats After Strikes
item.description: Bloomberg’s Patrick Howell O'Neill discusses warnings from US officials of low-level cyberattacks by Iran after the airstrikes on the country's nuclear facilities. He joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Bounces 1% as Qatar Says It Thwarted Iranian Missiles
item.description: US stocks advanced on Monday in a volatile start to the week after Qatar said it successfully intercepted Iranian missile attacks with no casualties and President Donald Trump indicated no interest in escalating from here.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Modernizing Wire Harnesses for the Aerospace Industry
item.description: Jordan Black, CEO and founder of Senra Systems, explains how his startup is streamlining the supply chain around wire harnesses used by aerospace and defense companies. Black talks about the company’s $25 million Series A fundraise with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Treasuries Gain as Traders Seek Havens, July Fed-Cut Bets Grow
item.description: Treasuries gained on Monday following Iran’s retaliatory attack on a US air base, adding to demand for the debt as a haven from tensions in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie, Ye Xie

item.title: Tech Investor Sees Opportunity in Asymmetric Threats
item.description: Venture capital investor Neil Keegan says the US is making positive changes to how it buys military technology. Keegan, the CEO of Marlinspike, discusses the opportunities the situation opens for investors with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tesla Launches Robotaxi Service
item.description: Tesla began offering its driverless taxi service to a handful of riders over the weekend. Regina Clewlow, CEO and co-founder of Populus, a mobility analytics software company, discusses the launch and the growth of the robotaxi sector with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Strikes on Iran: Evaluating the Impact
item.description: This is the moment for intelligence officers to shine, says Emily Harding, director of CSIS's Intelligence, National Security, and Technology Program. She joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: FTC Clears Omnicom Deal After Barring Advertising Boycotts Over Politics
item.description: Omnicom Group Inc., the third-largest US advertising agency, agreed to stop withholding online ads for political reasons to clear the way for federal antitrust regulators to approve the company’s $13.5 billion buyout of rival Interpublic Group.
item.dc:creator: Jef Feeley

media:content.media:description: The Federal Trade Commission headquarters in Washington, DC.

item.title: Iran Launches Missiles Toward US Bases in Qatar | Bloomberg Markets 6/23/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Former Deputy National Security Advisor to President Trump Victoria Coates, Morgan Stanley Investment Management CIO of Cross-Asset Solutions Jim Caron and Citi Global Head of Commodities Research Max Layton. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: IMF Approves $1.3 Billion for Bangladesh as Reforms Advance
item.description: The International Monetary Fund’s executive board has approved a total of $1.3 billion in funding for Bangladesh as part of the ongoing loan program, as the South Asian country pushes ahead with currency and tax reforms.
item.dc:creator: Arun Devnath

item.title: Oil Plunges as Iran Response to US Strikes Spares Energy Assets
item.description: Oil plunged by more than 7% as Iran’s response to US military strikes spared energy infrastructure, allaying investor concerns that the conflict would severely disrupt supplies from the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Alex Longley

media:content.media:description: Smoke from the Shahran oil depot, following a missile strike northwest of Tehran, on June 16. Photographer: ATTA KENARE/AFP

item.title: Copper Faces Historic Squeeze With LME Stockpiles Depleting Fast
item.description: One of the copper market’s biggest-ever squeezes is unfolding on the London Metal Exchange, as rapidly declining inventories push up spot prices.
item.dc:creator: Mark Burton

item.title: NY’s LIRR and Metro-North to Get More Than 300 New Rail Cars
item.description: New York City area commuters who ride the Long Island Rail Road and Metro-North Railroad are poised to get hundreds of new rail cars, but they’ll have to wait a few years.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Rembert

media:content.media:description: A Long Island Rail Road train at Grand Central Madison in New York.

item.title: Airlines Divert From Gulf Region as Iran Crisis Reverberates
item.description: Global airlines felt the brunt of the escalating conflict in the Middle East, as missile exchanges forced carriers to navigate around a wide swath of territory, tear up flight schedules and turn around aircraft mid-flight.
item.dc:creator: Leen Al-Rashdan

item.title: Energy in Focus as World Awaits Iran’s Response to US Strikes | Open Interest 6/23/2025
item.description: Get a jump start on the US trading day with Matt Miller, Katie Greifeld and Sonali Basak on "Bloomberg Open Interest." World braces for Iran’s response to US airstrikes. Amidst uncertainty in the Middle East, oil spike fades while the US dollar rises, witnessing a cautious bounce in US stocks. Iran vows retaliation against the US as Investors are watching the Strait of Hormuz. And Dan Morehead joins Open Interest to talk about crytocurrency as a safe haven asset. (Source: Bloomberg)
